revised_title: Method of Examining Photographic Objectives at Kew Observatory
tldr: The article describes the method of examining photographic objectives at the Kew Observatory, focusing on various tests such as curvature of the field, distortion, definition, achromatism, and astigmatism. The testing camera is employed for most of the examination, and the results are recorded using a system of numbering recommended by the International Photographic Congress of Paris in 1889.
